captions.text: [MUSIC - CHARITY VANCE, "ICING"]
-Hey, everyone.

I'm Mindy from Cute
Girls Hairstyles.

And today I have CGH
Number Four with me,
my little freckled dreamboat.

What are my favorite
things about you?
-My nose and my freckles.
-She's got it.
See, I tell her all the time.

So today I'm going
to show you how

to do a hairstyle that's
a great sporty hairstyle.

I did the Frenchbacks
all the time.

We're calling this one
waterfall into Frenchbacks,

because it's a little bit added
twist with a waterfall in it.
You're going to love it.

So we've started by parting
her hair into three sections.

So there's like
a middle section.

Will you tip your head
back as far as you can?
Thanks.

You can see there's
a middle section that

runs all the way down her
head, and then a right section
and a left.

And they're about
equal amounts of hair.

As best you can, get it
pretty close to equal.

We're going to start
with this middle section.

So I'm just going to
let this hair loose.

We're going to start
right up here in the top,
and we're going to pick up hair.

And we're going to be
doing a waterfall braid,

but we're going to be dropping
strands on both sides.

So we're going to
just start by doing
a normal stitch of a braid.

Now when I get to this left
side-- will you hold this
for me?
Thank you.

I'm going to drop that strand,
and then pick up more hair
and continue the braid.

When I get to the right
side, drop that strand,
pick up more hair.

So on each side, drop that
strand, pick up more hair.

And because we have
it already parted,

the picking up hair part
is really pretty simple,

because you just go in
here, find your part line,

and grab a little piece of
hair right where that is.

So again, drop
hair, pick up hair,

and continue this
braid all the way down.

Go in and pick up
hair and drop it.

Don't worry if it starts
getting a little bit loose.

That's OK, because
you'll see later,

we kind of go back in
and tighten it all up.
Whoops.
There you go, babe.

You can use a clip, if you're
doing this on yourself,
to hold the hair out of the way.

Since I have extra hands,
I'm going to utilize them.
Pick up, drop.
Thank you.
Pick up.
We've got one more pickup.
Drop this one, and pick this up.

Now, when you get
to the end, just

make sure you have all
the hair, and then just

do like a simple-- finish
it off with a simple braid.

But we're going to
undo this at the end,

so it doesn't really matter,
as long as you just get it

away from the head
far enough to just run
a big, fat elastic around it.

OK, now I've gone ahead and
completed this left side.

It only took me about a minute
and a half, two minutes.

And I'll show you how to
do it on this right side.

So we have the stranding
from the waterfall,

and then we have
our section that we
had held by the rubber band.
We're going to just let that go.

I'm going to flip all
these strands over,

so they're kind of out
of my way for the minute.

And I'm going to begin
a basic French braid.

The only difference is
that on this top side,

I'm going to add in a strand
from the waterfall braid
as opposed to just regular hair.

On this bottom side,
however, right here,

I am going to just scoop
up hair like you normally

would if you were
French braiding.

So again, on this
top, I'm only going
to add in a waterfall strand.

On this bottom, I'm
going to scoop up hair
like I would normally do it.
Add in a strand.
Scoop up hair.
Add in a strand on the top.

And in hair on the
bottom, like normal.

And you're just going
to work your way down

until you run out of hair
both on top and bottom.
Add in a strand.
Scoop up hair on bottom.
Along the back, same thing.
Add in hair.
Scoop up.

And you can pull those strands
tight as you're adding them in,

and that will flatten
them out if they
had come loose from before.
We're almost to the bottom.
Last little bit.

OK, and then when
we are done, I'm

just going to do a couple
stitches of normal braid right
here.

Now, there's lots of things
you could do at the end.

You could just combine them
all and make them a ponytail.

You can-- I'm going
to-- I think I'm

going to do this--
make them a braid.
I like the way this looks.

So I'm going to loosen
this one up like this,

and essentially make like
three strands out of all

of these braids, and just do one
big braid down at the bottom.

But certainly, just adding
it into a little ponytail

at the end with a ribbon
would be adorable.

There's lots of ways
to finish that off.
Would be cute.
And you are done.
There you go.

And you have-- tip your
head back and show them.
Oh, not that far.
[LAUGHTER]
There's good.
OK.

And you have this really cool--
tip back just a little bit more
so they can see the top.
There you go.
This really cool braid.
What do you think?
-Cool.
-Cool.

I think it looks
really cool, too.

I bet you'll love it if it's
for sports and athletics.

Be sure to check out
"Makeup to Breakups,"
since I'll put a link over here.

I got to be in an episode
with AndreasChoice,
and we discussed honesty.
You guys are going to love it.

We took some really good,
funny stories in it.

So be sure to check it out,
and we will see you guys later.
Bye.
-Bye.

-Now what if your
friend was the cheater?
-Ooh.

I don't know that I would
tell my friend's partner.

But I would totally
lay in to my friend.
-Yes.
-Like, let 'em have it.
[MUSIC - CHARITY VANCE, "ICING"]

title: Waterfall into Double Frenchbacks | Sport Hairstyles

comments.text:
Y'all have so many cute hair style ideas that just from looking at them 
seem to be very intricate and looks to be extremely hard to accomplish 
until you actually watch the video and see just how simple it really isto 
do yourself and how super cute it is to wear!!! I'm very excited that I 
found your account here on YouTube!! You now have a new subscriber and I 
can't wait to start recreating some of these fun styles myself!! Yay! 
Thanks for all you do in making people like me excited about my long hair 
again! Ps. Although I might not do this one on myself since I'm 30, but I 
will try it on my 9yr old sister (you saw right... My sister)! Hehe 😉 
Thanks again, Courtney 💖﻿

comments.author: cocatielcrazy

comments.text:
My best friend has A LOT of VERY THICK hair. High number of strands and 
each strand is very thick.
Summer of '13, she was the maid of honor and I was a bridesmaid in a 
friend's wedding and I was doing most of the girls' hair because I've been 
having so much fun wearing different hairstyles from you guys!
I used this hairstyle from you lovely ladies, but ended it in kind of a bun 
by wrapping and pinning the finished braids around each other. It was a 
HUGE hit! She was getting compliments all night about how awesome her hair 
looked and when people discovered it was me, people kept telling me how 
great of a job I did!
Moreover, her mom works at a high-end salon. She showed a picture of the 
style to her boss and her boss put it in their monthly employee newsletter 
about how popular braids are!
It was all thanks to you! Thank you SOOO MUCH for having hairstyles that 
work even on very thick hair! (It's the ONLY fancy updo she's ever worn 
that stayed in all day and all night, even with dancing!)
Btw, your video taught her how to do the zigzag braid. She did it on me for 
the same wedding and people thought my hair was adorable! ;)﻿
comments.author: Candy “AllthePeppermint” K

comments.text: thanks* so much i meant  lol ﻿

comments.text:
i did this hair style on my two daughters and they have long hair and it 
was pretty easy the only thing is that i couldn't get them to hold the hair 
for me so i had to put a bobbie pin on each side and put the hair into it 
while braided it...but other than that it was easy this looked so cute on 
them...love your videos i get so many compliments on their hair from 
watching your videos thats so much﻿
comments.author: nicole doyle

comments.text:
I just tried this hairstyle for the first time..it looked fine until I got 
the to end and tried to do the 3 equal parts out of all the braids, then it 
all bubbled up and looked horrible. So upset to have spent all that time to 
almost complete it then have to let it all down :( I just ended up doing a 
regular single French back instead!﻿
